title: Cassoday, Kansas
text:
Cassoday is a city in <a href="Butler%20County%2C%20Kansas">Butler County</a>, <a href="Kansas">Kansas</a>, United States. It is known as the "<a href="prairie%20chicken">Prairie Chicken</a> Capital of the World". As of the <a href="2020%20United%20States%20census">2020 census</a>, the population of the city was 113.
History.
Early history.
For many <a href="millennia">millennia</a>, the <a href="Great%20Plains">Great Plains</a> of <a href="North%20America">North America</a> was inhabited by <a href="nomadic">nomadic</a> <a href="Native%20Americans%20in%20the%20United%20States">Native Americans</a>. From the 16th century to 18th century, the <a href="Kingdom%20of%20France">Kingdom of France</a> claimed ownership of large parts of <a href="North%20America">North America</a>. In 1762, after the <a href="French%20and%20Indian%20War">French and Indian War</a>, France secretly ceded <a href="New%20France">New France</a> to <a href="Spain">Spain</a>, per the <a href="Treaty%20of%20Fontainebleau%20%281762%29">Treaty of Fontainebleau</a>.
19th century.
In 1802, Spain returned most of the land to France. In 1803, most of the land for <a href="History%20of%20Kansas">modern day Kansas</a> was acquired by the United States from France as part of the 828,000 square mile <a href="Louisiana%20Purchase">Louisiana Purchase</a> for 2.83 <a href="Penny%20%28United%20States%20coin%29">cents</a> per <a href="acre">acre</a>.
In 1854, the <a href="Kansas%20Territory">Kansas Territory</a> was organized, then in 1861 <a href="Kansas">Kansas</a> became the 34th <a href="U.S.%20state">U.S. state</a>. In 1855, <a href="Butler%20County%2C%20Kansas">Butler County</a> was established within the <a href="Kansas%20Territory">Kansas Territory</a>, which included the land for modern day Cassoday.
Cassoday was named for <a href="John%20B.%20Cassoday">John B. Cassoday</a>, chief justice of the <a href="Wisconsin%20Supreme%20Court">Wisconsin Supreme Court</a>.
The first post office was in Cassoday was established on July 9, 1906.
Geography.
Cassoday is located at (38.038545, -96.638252), in the scenic <a href="Flint%20Hills">Flint Hills</a>. According to the <a href="United%20States%20Census%20Bureau">United States Census Bureau</a>, the city has a total area of , all of it land.
Climate.
The climate in this area is characterized by hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. According to the <a href="K%C3%B6ppen%20Climate%20Classification">Köppen Climate Classification</a> system, Cassoday has a <a href="humid%20subtropical%20climate">humid subtropical climate</a>, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.
Demographics.
2010 census.
As of the <a href="census">census</a> of 2010, there were 129 people, 55 households, and 36 families residing in the city. The <a href="population%20density">population density</a> was . There were 70 housing units at an average density of . The racial makeup of the city was 95.3% <a href="White%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">White</a>, 1.6% <a href="African%20American%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">African American</a>, 0.8% <a href="Asian%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Asian</a>, 0.8% <a href="Race%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Pacific Islander</a>, and 1.6% from two or more races.
There were 55 households, of which 34.5% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 49.1% were <a href="Marriage">married couples</a> living together, 5.5% had a female householder with no husband present, 10.9% had a male householder with no wife present, and 34.5% were non-families. 30.9% of all households were made up of individuals, and 7.2% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.35 and the average family size was 2.94.
The median age in the city was 42.8 years. 27.9% of residents were under the age of 18; 7.1% were between the ages of 18 and 24; 17.9% were from 25 to 44; 29.6% were from 45 to 64; and 17.8% were 65 years of age or older. The gender makeup of the city was 51.2% male and 48.8% female.
2000 census.
As of the <a href="census">census</a> of 2000, there were 130 people, 54 households, and 36 families residing in the city. The <a href="population%20density">population density</a> was 393.4 people per square mile (152.1/km). There were 57 housing units at an average density of 172.5 per square mile (66.7/km). The racial makeup of the city was 100.00% <a href="White%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">White</a>. <a href="Hispanic%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Hispanic</a> or <a href="Latino%20%28U.S.%20Census%29">Latino</a> of any race were 3.85% of the population.
There were 54 households, out of which 25.9% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 59.3% were <a href="Marriage">married couples</a> living together, 7.4% had a female householder with no husband present, and 31.5% were non-families. 29.6% of all households were made up of individuals, and 14.8% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.41 and the average family size was 3.00.
In the city, the population was spread out, with 26.2% under the age of 18, 5.4% from 18 to 24, 26.9% from 25 to 44, 21.5% from 45 to 64, and 20.0% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 37 years. For every 100 females, there were 78.1 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 84.6 males.
The median income for a household in the city was $41,250, and the median income for a family was $49,688. Males had a median income of $31,875 versus $30,833 for females. The <a href="per%20capita%20income">per capita income</a> for the city was $17,807. There were 5.1% of families and 7.8% of the population living below the <a href="poverty%20line">poverty line</a>, including 19.0% of under eighteens and none of those over 64.
Government.
The Cassoday government consists of a mayor and five council members. The council meets once a month.
Education.
The community is served by <a href="Flinthills%20USD%20492">Flinthills USD 492</a> public school district. The Flinthills High School mascot is Flinthills Mustangs.
Cassoday High School was closed through school unification. The Cassoday High School mascot was Cassoday Longhorns.
Infrastructure.
Transportation.
<a href="K-177%20%28Kansas%20highway%29">K-177 Highway</a> and <a href="Southern%20Transcon">Southern Transcon</a> main line of <a href="BNSF%20Railway">BNSF Railway</a> both go through Matfield Green, while the <a href="Kansas%20Turnpike">Kansas Turnpike</a> <a href="toll%20road">toll road</a> passes immediately north of the city with a <a href="toll%20plaza">toll plaza</a> connected to Cassoday.
